X-Yahoo-Profile: tylerstreeter

I haven't posted to this group for a while, so I
thought I'd give an update for my project.  I renamed
it from Autonomous Virtual Humans to Verve.  Verve
will be an Open Source tool, mainly for game
developers.  The goal is to let game developers train
neural nets to control their characters (humans,
animals, monsters, robots, vehicles, etc.) to perform
any desired behavior, then use these "behavior
controllers" in a game instead of using scripted
animation sequences.

I still need to make a lot of improvements before this
tool will be usable, but I'm making progress.  I've
posted more info on the Verve website -
www.vrac.iastate.edu/~streeter/verve/main.html,
including two new videos that show a biped character
starting to walk.

Any comments are welcome.

Tyler Streeter

P.S.  I've been keeping up with the news on this group
over the past several months.  I especially like what
John Arrowwood has done to distribute the CPU load
during evolution.  I might spend some time in the
future trying to do something similar.
